newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo's sales sharply up in Netherlands.
newsitem.headline: Volvo's sales sharply up in Netherlands.

text.p: Volvo Cars, a unit of Swedish automative group AB Volvo, said on Wednesday its sales in the Netherlands increased by 65.1 percent to 1,848 cars in February compared to the month before.
Sales increased by 58.8 percent to 4,933 cars during January and February compared to the same period in 1996, Ulf Thorne, spokesman at Volvo Cars, told Reuters.
The total car market in the Netherlands rose by three percent in February and four percent in January-February.

"Our sales in the Netherlands are following the same trend as in the rest of Europe. The progress which started a couple of months ago last autumn is continuing. It is much thanks to the supply of S40/V40 (models), but also the rising number of models in all series," Thorne said.
